body: @vinodc Could you please test on Windows system?

@iSazonov This does work fine on the PowerShell that comes with Windows Server 2016, but I haven't had a chance to test with the specific version I used on Linux. Is that necessary for this issue to be resolved?
@vinodc It could help to understand that the Issue is Linux only or not.
@iSazonov We've confirmed this works fine on Windows, so it appears to be a Linux issue.
cc @dantraMSFT

We hit the same issue. Here are the request and response on Linux. After receiving 302, no further request was sent out. Request: HTTPS://ps.compliance.protection.outlook.com:443/PowerShell-LiveId?BasicAuthToOAuthConversion=true;PSVersion=6.1.0… Response: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2004/09/transfer/DeleteResponseuuid:13AC019D-CD80-4C3F-9563-89A18946C2C1F8FBAC6E-B1B0-0010-8986-6C70A64DD401http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2004/08/addressing/role/anonymousuuid:230BC4FC-763D-0005-0000-000000BF0000 http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2004/09/transfer/DeleteResponseuuid:13AC019D-CD80-4C3F-9563-89A18946C2C1F8FBAC6E-B1B0-0010-8986-6C70A64DD401http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2004/08/addressing/role/anonymousuuid:230BC4FC-763D-0005-0000-000000BF0000 [Session: 4 Date: 2018-09-19 18:26:24.0547291Z] HTTP/1.1 302 Found Location: https://nam02b.ps.compliance.protection.outlook.com/PowerShell-LiveId?BasicAuthToOAuthConversion=true;PSVersion=6.1.0 Server: Microsoft-IIS/8.0 request-id: 944f34bf-832b-48e8-a1a8-33574cce62f3 X-Powered-By: ASP.NET X-DiagInfo: BL2FFO11WS085 Date: Wed, 19 Sep 2018 18:26:24 GMT Content-Length: 234 Object moved

Object moved to here.

Right. We've currently implemented a workaround to make the initial request and capture the 302 `Location` header, then redo the connection to that URI instead. Would still be great to have it auto-resolve redirects at some point in time.
cc @PaulHigin

> Right. We've currently implemented a workaround to make the initial request and capture the 302 `Location` header, then redo the connection to that URI instead. 

How? I have the same problem.

Hi Guys,

Do you have any news about when it could be fixed ?

/cc @SteveL-MSFT 
AFAIK WinRM/OMI bridge is deprecated and we are no longer supporting it.

This is a bit of a pickle if WinRM/OMI bride is deprecated yet there is claimed support in ExchangeOnlineManagement for linux in 2.0.5+.  The requirement to use WinRM is due to the nature of the workflow established when connect-ippssession is invoked.  I would LOVE not to use it, or its wsman equivalent in linux.  So, is this an issue with Powershell Core or the Microsoft Security and Protection folks, because its a pretty big deal in my organization, and I would love to get it solved and am willing to test and work with anyone in MSFT on it.

Hey

Can you drop an email to ***@***.*** so that I can add you to the preview ?

From: toupeiro ***@***.***>
Sent: Wednesday, September 1, 2021 6:37 PM
To: PowerShell/PowerShell ***@***.***>
Cc: Navin Gupta ***@***.***>; Manual ***@***.***>
Subject: Re: [PowerShell/PowerShell] New-PSSession does not connect to a redirected URI when larger token-based authorization headers are provided (#7567)


This is a bit of a pickle if WinRM/OMI bride is deprecated yet there is claimed support in ExchangeOnlineManageme for linux in 2.0.5+. The requirement to use WinRM is due to the nature of the workflow established when connect-ippssession is invoked. I would LOVE not to use it, or its wsman equivalent in linux. So, is this an issue with Powershell Core or the Microsoft Security and Protection folks, because its a pretty big deal in my organization, and I would love to get it solved and am willing to test and work with anyone in MSFT on it.

-

I'd love to but unfortunately the address was redacted. :(

Can someone who repros this confirm if https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/PSWSMan resolves this problem? cc @jborean93
PSWSMan 2.2.1
Module to install and manage the forked WSMan client libraries for Linux and macOS. See https://github.com/jborean93/omi for more details.

I think it may still be a problem and not fixed even in my fork. I've yet to try and reproduce it myself but https://github.com/jborean93/omi/issues/36#issuecomment-907889875 seems like a similar problem.

Hey everyone, its 2022 and I'm still seeing a similar error on macOS where this redirect is not happening and a basic auth failure is returned. Can anyone confirm that this is still an active issue?

```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.2.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.2.2
OS                             Darwin 21.4.0 Darwin Kernel Version 21.4.0: Fri Mar 18 00:45:05 PDT 2022; root:xnu-8020.101.4~15/RELEASE_X86_64
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

**Error**
```
VERBOSE: ExchangeEnvironment : O365Default
VERBOSE: ConnectionUri : https://ps.compliance.protection.outlook.com/PowerShell-LiveId
VERBOSE: AzureADAuthorizationEndpointUri : https://login.microsoftonline.com/organizations
VERBOSE: DelegatedOrganization :
VERBOSE: Prefix :
VERBOSE: FormatTypeName :*
VERBOSE: CommandName :*
VERBOSE: Importing cmdlet 'Add-EXOClientTelemetryWrapper'.
VERBOSE: Importing cmdlet 'New-EXOClientTelemetryFilepath'.
VERBOSE: Importing cmdlet 'Push-EXOTelemetryRecord'.
VERBOSE: Importing cmdlet 'Clear-ActiveToken'.
VERBOSE: Importing cmdlet 'New-ExoPSSession'.
VERBOSE: Importing cmdlet 'Test-ActiveToken'.
Exception: Connecting to remote server ps.compliance.protection.outlook.com failed with the following error message : Basic Authorization failed for user
**********@contoso.com For more information, see the about_Remote_Troubleshooting Help topic.
```
What the, is this MS, claiming to support Powershell EO management module on Linux but the dependencies are broke or deprecated and not supported..? Guess am back on the Windows host again... /sigh

Same issue. Can this be resolved?

PS /tmp> Connect-IPPSSession
Exception: Connecting to remote server ps.compliance.protection.outlook.com failed with the following error message : Basic Authorization failed for user XXX@domain.tld For more information, see the about_Remote_Troubleshooting Help topic.

Seemingly running into this on setting authenticationpolicies now too.

Have done this on linux many times before without issues.

PS /home/freaky> get-user | Set-User -AuthenticationPolicy ALLOW-BasicAuth-SMTP
OperationStopped: Sending data to a remote command failed with the following error message: Basic Authorization failed for user xxx@yyy.zzz For more information, see the about_Remote_Troubleshooting Help topic.
